info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 06 at 4:59PM CST until March 06 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST FOR NORTHEASTERN LOGAN AND SOUTH CENTRAL JOHNSON COUNTIES... At 458 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Tokalon, or 4 miles southwest of Knoxville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Lamar... Knoxville... Scranton... Spadra... Tokalon... Lake Dardanelle... Morrison Bluff... Dublin... Ludwig... Piney Bay Recreation Area... New Blaine... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 58 and 70. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
